A
COLLABARATIVE
LEARNING PLATFORM

Sugar Labs is creator of the award-winning Sugar Learning Platform, which promotes collaborative learning through Sugar Activities

SUGAR

Learning software for children

Sugar is a learning platform that reinvents how computers are used for education. Collaboration, reflection, and discovery are integrated directly into the user interface. Sugar promotes "studio thinking" and "reflective practice". Through Sugar's clarity of design, children and teachers have the opportunity to use computers on their own terms. Students can reshape, reinvent, and reapply both software and content into powerful learning activities. Sugar's focus on sharing, criticism, and exploration is grounded in the culture of free software (FLOSS).

Glimpse of Sugar...

This is sugar!

Every user is greeted with this homepage view when they open Sugar. The colour of the icon in the middle can be changed.


In the Sugar Neighborhood view, learners see their friends clustered around their current Activities; from this view they can join each otherâ€™s Activities. Sugar collaboration works "peer to peer," in a classroom or under a tree; Sugar does not require the Internet.


This is one of the many other fun activities present in Sugar. Check out all the other activities.

Have a taste of sugar on your browser right now!

Try now!

Get Sugar

Check out this link - Get Sugar (or) Browse through the content below.

Sugar on a stick
(SOAS)

The full Sugar environment on any computer at any time from a thumb drive.

  • Sugar on a Stick requires a thumb drive with at least 2GB storage and downloading ~650MB.
  • (Sugar on a Stick is available for free and does not permanently affect your computer.)
  • How to create a Sugar stick?

Gnu/Linux
Install

The full Sugar environment installed on a GNU/Linux computer.

  • Sugar is available as a desktop environment on GNU/Linux. Up to date packages are available for Fedora, Debian, Ubuntu and many other distros.

Sugarizer
(alpha)

A taste of Sugar within your browser.

  • Sugarizer provides basic Sugar features and some Activities. Sugarizer works in any modern browser, on mobile, tablet or desktop.
  • Use Sugarizer online, download the app or set up a server.
  • Try Sugarizer!

OLPC XO

The full Sugar environment on a OLPC XO laptop.

  • Sugar can be installed on a OLPC XO laptop.
  • How to get Sugar on a OLPC XO Laptop?

Raspberry Pi

The full Sugar environment on a Raspberry Pi.

  • Sugar can be installed on a Raspberry Pi.
  • How to get Sugar on a Raspberry Pi?

Social help

This is a place where where you can discuss Sugar Activities. You can: Get Help, Share Your Creations, Report Bugs, Discuss Ideas for the Activity, Any Other Activity-Related Topic.
Social Help Page

Join the conversation

Sugar Labs is an organization built around engaging people. We strive to create software that works well for teachers and students - something that can only happen with your engagement. Join us on Social Help or on our "It's An Education Project" mailing list. Don't feel shy to raise concerns and bring feedback to the table.

About Us

At Sugar Labs, we make a collection of tools that learners use to explore, discover, create, and reflect. We are non-profit and led by volunteers. We distribute these tools freely and encourage our users to appropriate them, taking ownership and responsibility for their learning. Sugar Labs, a volunteer-driven, non-profit organization, had its origins in the One Laptop per Child project and is now a member project of the Software Freedom Conservancy. The mission of Sugar Labs is to support the Sugar community of users and developers and establish regional, autonomous â€œSugar Labsâ€ around the world to help learners â€œlearn how to learnâ€ by tailoring Sugar to local languages and curricula.

    Cups Of Coffee

"What I would like from marketing is some mechanism for highlighting the powerful ideas in Sugar that seem to be lacking in most other systems so that even if a school decides to go with a different product/project, they put pressure on that project to provide tools, not apps, collaboration, transparency, self reflection and group critique, and responsibility on the shoulders of students and teachers to shape their own world."

Walter Bender Founder-Sugar Labs

"A successful technology creates problems that only it can solve."

Alan Kay

"Fedora-Based Sugar on a Stick Is One Sweet Desktop."
